FuncDef:
The nat exchange user public-ip command configures the update time of public IP addresses.
The undo nat exchange user public-ip command restores the default configuration.
By default, the update time for public IP addresses is not configured.
CLIs: undo nat exchange user public-ip [ at <time-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the update time for public IP addresses.
The format is hh:mm:ss, where hh ranges from 0 to 23, mm ranges from 0 to 59, and ss ranges from 0 to 59.

Examples: Warning: Packet loss may occur for a while during user IP address update, and this may affect the performance. [Y/N]: Y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The log tracing server cannot identify users based on the port range. In response, a new method of identifying attack users based on log tracing is introduced. Specifically, the mapping between the public and private IP addresses is updated on a regular basis. Based on the intersection of private IP addresses identified at each public IP address update, the filtered private IP addresses are considered the IP addresses of users who are prone to illegitimate behavior.
Precautions
The forcible and periodic change in public IP addresses assigned to private network users is mutually exclusive with the NAT server, NAT server mode, port-forwarding, port-single function, and overloaded address pool function.
After a device is enabled to forcibly and periodically change public IP addresses assigned to private network users, user services are interrupted and flows must be reestablished during the public IP address change.
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
